response.answer_text: Nanofabrication is the manufacture of materials with nanometer dimensions. There are different types of Nano-fabrication Techniques such as- Patterning i.e. LithographyOptical LithographyElectron beam LithographyFilm Modification i.e. EtchingWet EtchingDry EtchingThin Film DepositionPhysical Vapor Deposition (PVD)Chemical Vapor Deposition (CVD)

Nanofabrication  (Source of an Image - Google) Nanofabrication is the design and manufacture of devices with dimensions measured in nanometers. One nanometer is 10 -9 meter, or a millionth of a millimeter. Nanofabrication is of interest to computer engineers because it opens the door to super-high-density microprocessor s and memory chip s. It has been suggested that each data bit could be stored in a single atom. Carrying this further, a single atom might even be able to represent a byte or word of data. Nanofabrication has also caught the attention of the medical industry, the military, and the aerospace industry. There are several ways that nanofabrication might be done. One method involves scaling down integrated-circuit ( IC ) fabrication that has been standard since the 1970s, removing one atom at a time until the desired structure emerges. A more sophisticated hypothetical scheme involves the assembly of a chip atom-by-atom; this would resemble bricklaying. An extension of this is the notion that a chip might assemble itself atom-by-atom using programmable nanomachines. Finally, it has been suggested that a so-called biochip might be grown like a plant from seed; the components would form by a process resembling cell division in living things. For more information visit this site: whatis.techtarget. com/definition/nanofabrication I hope it will help you. :)

Nanofabrication is the design and manufacture of devices with dimensions measured in nanometers. One nanometer is 10–9 meter, or a millionth of a millimeter. Nanofabrication is of interest to computer engineers because it opens the door to super-high-density microprocessor s and memory chip s. It has been suggested that each data bit could be stored in a single atom . Carrying this further, a single atom might even be able to represent a byte or word of data. Nanofabrication has also caught the attention of the medical industry, the military, and the aerospace industry. There are several ways that nanofabrication might be done. One method involves scaling down integrated-circuit ( IC ) fabrication that has been standard since the 1970s, removing one atom at a time until the desired structure emerges. A more sophisticated hypothetical scheme involves the assembly of a chip atom-by-atom; this would resemble bricklaying. An extension of this is the notion that a chip might assemble itself atom-by-atom using programmable nanomachines. Finally, it has been suggested that a so-called biochip might be grown like a plant from a seed; the components would form by a process resembling cell division in living things.

Still science fiction, AFAIK. The idea is to somehow program “nanobots” (ultra-tiny robots) to assembly macroscopic objects out of the basic molecules. Now, you could also call any process that “patterns” devices with nanometer-scale structures a form of “nanofabrication”, in which case all modern LSI chips would in principle qualify; but I consider that a sly manipulation of terminology, much as “quantum computing” is bandied about these days.

Nano fabrication referee to the design process of “Nano metrial" and devices that are measured in nano meters .(10 power 6 )  It is also called as “macro fabrication. It is a process used to construct physical objects with dimensions in the nano meter to millimetre range .  The objects are devices are comprised of a range of miniature structures, including moving parts , static structures, chemically sensitive surfaces and electrical devices. Basic nanofabric techniques are: 1.lithography 2.deposition of doping. 3.elctropating 4.etching and substrate removal.

Nanofabrication is the design and manufacture of devices with dimensions measured in nanometers. One nanometer is 10 -9 meter, or a millionth of a millimeter. Nanofabrication is of interest to computer engineers because it opens the door to super-high-density microprocessor s and memory chip s.

Fabrication is production of parts by cutting, bending etc. Similarly, nanofabrication is production of nanometer sized parts/ materials. Nanofabrication processes or techniques comes under top-down approach in nanotechnology which is making nanomaterial from bulk material. Some notable nanofabrication processes are Photolithography High Energy Ball Milling

Design and manufacture of devices with dimensions measured in nanometers. Includes like designing and manufacture of super high density micro processors and memory chips. Each data bit could be stored in a single atom.
Nanofabrication in simple terms, is the fabrication, design and manufacture technique of materials that have measure scale ranging from 1nm to 100 nm.

K Eric Drexler wrote a PhD thesis in 1991 where he explored the concept of molecular scale or nano-scale assembly, which began a whole new way of thinking about the topic. I would say this PhD thesis ranks up there with DeBroglie’s wave particle duality thesis of 1924, for which DeBroglie received the Nobel Prize in physics. Drexler deserves similar recognition for this master work. Molecular machinery and manufacturing with applications to computation
Nanofabrication is the design and manufacture of devices with dimensions measured in nanometers. One nanometer is 10^-9 meter, or a millionth of a millimeter.

Nanolithography is a growing field of techniques within nanotechnology dealing with the engineering of nanometer-scale structures. From Greek, the word can be broken up into three parts: "nano" meaning dwarf, "lith" meaning stone, and "graphy" meaning to write, or "tiny writing onto stone."
Nanofabrication is the design and manufacture of devices with dimensions measured in nanometers .
